input: We were able to reserve a spot at the chef tasting bar with Morimoto who actually called in sick that night, but we were still charged full price.
reason: Reservation process was satisfactory. Chef's absence was mentioned neutrally, but being charged full price led to clear disappointment.

input: We were a bit chatty so it took us a while to decide what to order, but when we made it abundantly clear we were ready (closed the menu, looked around for our waiter) he was slammed from the recent filling of the space.
reason: The customers experienced service annoyance due to waiting, as the staff member was mentioned factually as overwhelmed, explaining the service delay.

input: The place is small, the host was friendly and communicative -- we had to wait 45 minutes for a table but they don't take reservations and clearly it's a popular spot.
reason: The review comments on small ambience, friendly staff, and long wait service, which is explained by no reservations and the place's popularity.

input: The only apparent flavor in any of the dishes was heat, and a table of four gourmands left at least half of our meals on our plates.
reason: The review criticizes the lack of flavor and uneaten portions, indicating strong negative feelings towards the food, aligning with disappointment.

input: Our waitress couldn't tell us what was in the seafood special, forgot to put in our oyster order so it came at the same time as the main meals, wasn't able to provide a confident recommendation from the menu, and had to be flagged several times for drinks.
reason: The waitress's various shortcomings, from lacking menu knowledge to poor attentiveness and order errors, generated both disappointment and annoyance.

input: The menu had more selections, price points that fit all our budgets and a new Sushi menu that went over huge with the table.
reason: The review expresses satisfaction with menu selections and prices, alongside admiration for the successful new sushi menu offerings.

input: The huge terrace is just so beautiful--and rumor has it they'll be tenting the space this fall, so we midtowners can continue to dine outside through the end of the year.
reason: Identify the "huge terrace" as AMBIENCE, with "beautiful" indicating positive admiration. The tenting for continued dining also falls under AMBIENCE, expressing satisfaction.

input: I had to physically get out of my seat and find the waitress twice just to ask for more water.
reason: The review expresses frustration over needing to repeatedly seek out the waitress for water, indicating inefficient service and resulting annoyance.

input: A dish of chewy smoked seitan evokes Peking duck, while an entree of wide green-tea noodles is served in a tasty faux Bolognese sauce.
reason: The review explicitly praises two distinct dishes, describing their appealing qualities with words like 'evokes Peking duck' and 'tasty'.

input: About a half hour wait with reservations.
reason: The review expresses frustration with a long wait time despite having reservations, fitting the 'annoyance' emotion for 'service'.

input: When the waitress brought the check after an hour, she finally noticed that I had been sitting without food and offered to get it for me.
reason: The review expresses annoyance regarding slow food service, indicating an operational issue. Mixed emotions arise from the waitress's delayed attention followed by a helpful offer.

input: The drinks are cute as is concept--unfortunately, the service is not and neither is the wait.
reason: The review positively evaluates the drinks and concept with satisfaction. Conversely, the service and wait time cause annoyance for the reviewer.

input: To be honest, it cost $95 for two adults and a kid (including only two beers for the adults), and the only things worth eating were the raw oysters, information about which the staff was not too sure.
reason: The reviewer expressed disappointment regarding the high price, limited worthwhile food options, and the staff's lack of information.

input: So, if you don't care about speedy service, go; but if you aren't in the habit of lighting your cigarette with twenties, avoid the tapas.
reason: The review expresses annoyance regarding slow service and expensive prices, leading to disappointment about the value of the tapas.

input: However for the price I paid to have dinner there, you would have thought I ate a horse.
reason: The reviewer felt the cost was excessive, expressing disappointment regarding the value for money received for the dinner.

input: Our waitress was a bit cold but she was still attentive and food came quickly.
reason: The waitress exhibited both coldness and attentiveness leading to mixed emotions about staff, while fast food delivery resulted in service satisfaction.

input: Then the staff behind the buffett just haven't gotten their groove yet, so you order your food and wait five minutes while it sits behind the glass on a plate, getting cold.
reason: Staff's inefficiency generated annoyance. The lengthy service wait was also annoying, and the cold food caused customer disappointment.

input: Lastly the waiters and bartender should learn to have argurments in private and not in front of customers.
reason: The review criticizes the staff's unprofessional behavior of arguing publicly, indicating annoyance due to an inconvenient, irritating experience.

input: The dessert was as good as the waiter said it would be.
reason: The good dessert indicates satisfaction with food; the waiter's accurate prediction suggests satisfaction regarding staff's helpfulness.

input: The waitress, host, and bus staff were sitting around at the bar while the patrons were all complaining about the service.
reason: Staff's inactivity directly led to poor service, causing patrons to complain, therefore indicating negative annoyance for both aspects.

input: After having the table cleared and recieving fresh warm plates, we shared the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Chicken and Lentils.
reason: Efficient table clearing and fresh warm plates signify positive service, evoking satisfaction. Food items are merely mentioned factually, resulting in no emotion.

input: Upon explaining, the waiter confronted us as we left and spewed a stream of profanities at us as we walked out the door.
reason: The waiter's unprofessional behavior, explicitly involving profanities, represents a significant let-down in expected staff conduct, thus disappointment.

input: After a couple of drinks upstairs before our meal, we slipped downstairs to a nice corner table that offered plenty of privacy in this 'loud' place.
reason: The reviewer appreciates the privacy and table but dislikes the loud environment, resulting in mixed emotions regarding the ambience.

input: True, the service is hardly on par with the finer restaurants in NYC, but I go for the energy and the tasty tapas-like seafood treats that are perfect with beer or sake.
reason: The review highlights negative service quality, indicating disappointment. The vibrant energy and tasty seafood both evoke positive satisfaction.

input: The busboy kept our glasses full; the waiter warmed up to our table at the end of the night by cracking jokes.
reason: The busboy's attentiveness earned gratitude, while the waiter's friendly jokes created a satisfying experience overall.

input: My wife and I invited our friends to a late dinner and were having drinks afterwards when the manager instructed the waitress not to serve us any more drinks as it was bottle service.
reason: The manager's instruction to deny more drinks constitutes a negative staff action, causing annoyance due to an unexpected service limitation.

input: A narrow corridor leads to a tiny space where there are three tiny white tiled counters, a great deal of mess (stacks of bottles, cans) and a small counter holding 12-14 entrees.
reason: The review describes a cramped and messy physical environment, which evokes annoyance due to inconvenience and lack of tidiness for the ambience.

input: I got the Paella Marinera which was beyond filling in itself, but before it even came, the waitstaff provided more than ample appetizers for my group that by the time that the meal came to us, we were so stuffed, we could barely finish up the meal.
reason: The reviewer expressed satisfaction with the Paella's generous portion and the waitstaff's provision of ample appetizers.

input: Pastas include shellfish-stocked linguine with tomato sauce, and an excellent homemade cheese ravioli--all are available in half portions.
reason: The excellent homemade cheese ravioli elicits admiration for food. The availability of half portions is a factual menu offering, thus no emotion.

input: The Scene  With flickering sconces and rough-hewn brick walls, Crispo may look like an elegantly restored Italian farmhouse, but frenzied servers, tight tables and wait-list hopefuls at the marble bar make it feel like a city-slick hotspot.
reason: The review praises the elegant decor (ambience, admiration) but criticizes frenzied service and crowded, uncomfortable ambience, causing annoyance for patrons.

input: Last night the dining room was crammed and seemingly only had one waiter which is ludicrous.
reason: The crowded dining room contributes to negative ambience, evoking annoyance. Inadequate staff levels also provoke annoyance concerning service efficiency.

input: I have worked in the restaurant industry for 5 years, and so am understanding of things out of my server's control, and I have never experienced such poor service!
reason: The reviewer explicitly states "poor service," indicating strong unmet expectations and a let-down regarding the operational processes.

input: The waiter was pretty anxious to get us in-and-out, although there were ample tables and my friend and I opted to sit at the bar.
reason: The waiter's eagerness to rush patrons created annoyance; however, the plentiful tables contributed to a comfortable ambience and satisfaction.

input: The waiter didn't know the menu, didn't bring more than one item at a time, and put some orders in twice with the kitchen.
reason: The waiter's inability to know the menu caused disappointment. Inefficient item delivery and duplicate orders led to clear service annoyance.

input: The band is positioned in front of the windows, in a space roughly the size of a living room.
reason: The sentence provides a factual description of the physical space's layout and size. No positive or negative sentiment or emotion is expressed.

input: The owners couldn't have been more accomodating -- we had the entire restaurant to ourselves on a Saturday (before it opens to the public for dinner).
reason: The owners' accommodating actions evoked gratitude. Having the restaurant to themselves brought satisfaction regarding the ambience. Two distinct positive emotions.

input: I definitely liked the vibe in the restaurant - the food is good with enough variety to please everyone - I'd say the portions were quite skimpy where it counts - meat whether fish or steak - and for those prices this is very irksome.
reason: The review expresses satisfaction for ambience, food, and menu variety. Negative sentiment comes from skimpy food portions causing disappointment and high prices leading to annoyance.

input: The food was delicious, and the menu provided ample choices which suited all of the eaters in our party from the most daring to the most conservative.
reason: The review positively evaluates food quality as delicious and praises the menu's ample choices, reflecting admiration for both.

input: After 10 minutes of waiting, he finally returned to the table and snootily explained to us that the wine he had opened was actually better and more expensive (not yet on the menu, of course), but he would charge us the price of the bottle we had originally ordered.
reason: The review expresses annoyance with the long wait time, the staff's snooty attitude, and the problematic handling of the wine order.

input: The chef will not alter any of the three tasting menus.
reason: The chef is mentioned only as background for the menu policy, with no evaluation of their attitude. The menu's inflexibility is stated factually.

input: The food was great so that made up for the lack of service from the waitress.
reason: The review expressed admiration for the excellent food quality. The waitress's lack of service, however, caused distinct annoyance.

input: However, unlike a lot of places the service was great: we walked in after not being able to get a reservation and were seated within 10 mins.
reason: The review explicitly praises the service as 'great' due to efficient seating despite no reservation, indicating strong positive evaluation.

input: After the wonderful anipasto tray came, it was 60 minutes before our plates were removed and dinner was brought.
reason: The antipasto tray received strong positive praise. However, the sixty-minute wait for dinner indicated negative service efficiently.

input: Fresh fish, tender milk fed veal and outrageous Veal Chops adorn their menu and special list.
reason: Admiration is assigned to the food's fresh, tender, and outrageous qualities. The menu aspect receives satisfaction for featuring such desirable items.

input: The rude and unaccomodating hostess (who we later learned was the manager) repeatedly promised us the next table but never offered to buy us a drink while we waited.
reason: The review highlights the manager's rude and unaccommodating attitude, along with unfulfilled promises, causing clear frustration and irritation for customers.

input: The food was great but the music was loud and hip-hop and the wait was ridiculous and the prices were out of this world.
reason: Food was admirable, but loud music and ridiculous wait led to annoyance. Exorbitant prices caused significant disappointment for the reviewer.

input: the soups were superb and only $2 a bowl, and the entire dinner, with beers, cost less than $30 for two people.
reason: Food quality receives admiration for being superb; overall price points for soups and dinner elicit satisfaction due to affordability.

input: My only two complaints are that (1) our server was a real space cadet and kinda inattentive and (2) the sodas were really small; overall, though, I had a great time and really enjoyed my dinner!
reason: The review expressed annoyance regarding staff inattentiveness and small soda portions, yet conveyed overall satisfaction with the dining experience.

input: Thankfully, a succinct menu leaves little to ponder--and, despite the high churn, burgers always arrive as specified.
reason: The review praises the succinct menu for its ease, contributing to satisfaction. Service is also appreciated for accurate food delivery.

input: Best Baked Ziti in the area, great classic NY pizza.
reason: The review praises specific dishes, Baked Ziti and NY pizza, with strong positive language, indicating admiration for their impressive quality.
